com.github.hotware.lucene.extension.filter.tagging

Class TaggingFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.util.AttributeSource
      • org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
        • org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenFilter
          • com.github.hotware.lucene.extension.filter.tagging.TaggingFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NextTokenTaggingFilter, StartEndTaggingFilter

    public abstract class TaggingFilter
extends org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenFilter
    Base Class for TaggingFilters (tagging in the textfield itself, no custom attributes). Implementing Classes should not tag empty strings
    Author:
    Martin Braun

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void deleteToken()
      delete the current token
      protected void finishedHandlingTagsForCurrentToken()
      callback
      protected abstract boolean handleNewToken(String curTerm)
      called everytime a new token is read. here you can specify the logic that handles the original version of the token and controls whether we should produce taggedVersions or we should skip to the next token. this is called from the incrementToken method and should return values corresponding to that
      boolean incrementToken() 
      protected void nextToken()
      call this if you want to continue with the next token in the stream.
      protected void nonMarkerTokenFound()
      call this if the tagged versions should be produced in the next call of incrementTokens()

    • Field Detail

      • currentTags

        protected final List<String> currentTags

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaggingFilter

        public TaggingFilter(org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream input,
                     IndexFormatProvider indexFormatProvider,
                     boolean produceTagAttribute,
                     boolean produceTaggedVersions)
        Parameters:
        input - The input TokenStream for this filter
        patternForStartTag - pattern for the start tag. has to contain one capturing group to determine the tag name.
        patternForEndTag - pattern for the end tag. has to contain one capturing group to determine the tag name.
        indexFormatProvider - the IndexFormatProvider to use with this filter instance
        allowMarkerTokens - true if marker tokens (start and end tag) should be written into the index. these will not be passed to the provided indexFormatProvider

    • Method Detail

                             throws IOException

      • handleNewToken

        protected abstract boolean handleNewToken(String curTerm)
        called everytime a new token is read. here you can specify the logic that handles the original version of the token and controls whether we should produce taggedVersions or we should skip to the next token. this is called from the incrementToken method and should return values corresponding to that
        Parameters:
        curTerm -
        Returns:
